intro: Astragalus paposanus, commonly known as the Sierra Madre milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions, and it plays a role in soil stabilization. Astragalus paposanus is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
